de.mixedfx.network

Class NetworkManager

  • java.lang.Object
    • de.mixedfx.network.NetworkManager

  • public class NetworkManager
extends java.lang.Object

    Builds up a network. Manually only host server must be called and Message received or send. Connection to a host server or someone who is connected to the host server will be established automatically. If an error occur only a NETWORK_FATALERROR is sent over the eventBus. If you may want to set the port use setPort(int). (Usually only necessary if there was an fatal error)

    • Field Detail

      • NETWORK_FATALERROR

        public static final java.lang.String NETWORK_FATALERROR
        Register for this event over EventBusExtended or EventBus if you want to be informed that there was a network error which closed the entire network. You have to call again init() to initialize the network. Further information: This error does relate to the UDP Server in most cases (not if NetworkConfig.status = NetworkConfig.States.Server). The cause probably is the Port. React to that error with setPort(int) with the recommendation to choose a number between 10 000 and 60 000!
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • online

        public static javafx.beans.property.BooleanProperty online
        Represents the status. True means the network connection is established with at least one Participant (as NetworkConfig.States.Server or NetworkConfig.States.BoundToServer). False means that no connection is yet established. This value changes only, it is not invalidated.

      • t

        protected static TCPCoordinator t

      • u

        protected static UDPCoordinator u

    • Constructor Detail

      • NetworkManager

        public NetworkManager()

    • Method Detail

      • init

        public static void init()

        Initializes UDP and TCP connection. Start listening and broadcasting on UDP connection and automatically sets up a TCP connection if NetworkConfig.States.BoundToServer or if NetworkConfig.States.Server application was found. Use MessageBus to deal with Message! Use online [reading] to listen to the NetworkStatus.

      • setPort

        public static void setPort(int portNumber)
        Default port is NetworkConfig.PORT. This port is mostly necessary for the UDP Server. In case of TCP the port + 1 to 5 is asked if port is not available.

      • getPort

        public static int getPort()
        Returns:
        Returns the current port.

      • main

        public static void main(java.lang.String[] args)
